question: Question_B_03_(c)
statement:
Let \emph{A} be a certain $2\times 3$ matrix. Suppose that using
elementary row operations, the matrix \emph{A} can be transformed into
the matrix

\[U = \begin{bmatrix} 
1 & 0 & -7 \\
0 & 1 & 4
\end{bmatrix}\]

Find all solutions, if any, of the system
$Ax = A\begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ -2 \end{bmatrix}$
sols:
Rewriting the given equation gives

\begin{align*}
A\mathbf{x} &= A\begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ -2\end{bmatrix} \\
0 &= A\mathbf{x} - A\begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ -2\end{bmatrix} \\
&= A\underbrace{\left(\mathbf{x}-\begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ -2\end{bmatrix}\right)}_{=\mathbf{y}}
\end{align*}

From
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH152/April_2013/Question_B_03_(a)}{part
(a)} we know that the solution to this homogeneous equation is given by

\[\mathbf{y} = a\begin{bmatrix} 7 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}\]

Solving for \textbf{\emph{x}} we obtain

\[\mathbf{x} = \mathbf{y} + \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ -2\end{bmatrix} = a\begin{bmatrix} 7 \\ -4 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix} 0 \\ 1 \\ -2\end{bmatrix}\]
hints:
The matrix \emph{U} only reveals information about the homogeneous
system $Ay = 0$. Can you rewrite the given equation to a homogeneous
system?
